TravelTriangle > Blog > Rajasthan > 5 Popular Hill Stations In Rajasthan For A Refreshing Escape From The Desert In 2025 5 Popular Hill Stations In Rajasthan For A Refreshing Escape From The Desert In 2025 .. SHARES Updated Date: 14 January 2025 Whether it is about escaping from the heinous heat of Rajasthan or the hectic lifestyle of the glorious state, the hill stations will always be one of your best options. Besides being a perfect place for spending some me-time, these places can also help you to indulge in numerous adventurous activities, which will enhance your overall traveling experience by a mile. Along with these, the hill stations in Rajasthan also offer a marvelous view of landscapes, which can aid you in forgetting all your stress. So, if you want to get away from the busy life of Rajasthan and wish to rejuvenate yourself, then make sure to visit the following hill stations.  Table Of Content Top 5 Hill Stations In And Near Rajasthan In 2025 Hill Stations In Rajasthan Region Distance From City Mode Of Transport Mount Abu Near Udaipur 163 Kms Bus/Cab Guru Shikhar Near Mount Abu 15 Kms Cab Sajjangarh Near Udaipur 10 Kms Cab Achalgarh Near Mount Abu 11 Kms Cab Ranakpur Near Jodhpur 96 Kms Bus/Cab 5 Best Hill Stations In Rajasthan Along with numerous exquisite pieces of architecture and a bright and beautiful culture, the Indian state of Rajasthan boasts of some picture-perfect mountains. Some of them have been listed here: Mount Abu Guru Shikhar Sajjangarh Achalgarh Ranakpur 1. Mount Abu A picturesque place with magnificent architectural structures and luxuriant greenery, one of the small yet famous hill stations in Rajasthan, Mount Abu looks absolutely awe-striking during the daytime. Due to its gorgeous scenery and scenic backdrop of Aravalli Mountain, this pretty hill station receives thousands of visitors every year from all over the world. Besides the enchanting scenery, these famous hill stations in Rajasthan for couples also offer numerous temples to travellers, which are known for their architectural brilliance. Amidst these holy places, the Dilwara Temples are quite popular among tourists because of the intricate carvings and ornamented interiors.  Other than visiting the temples, you can spend some time alone in this beautiful hill station, too, by roaming in the forests. If you wish to, then you can also indulge yourself in watching the pleasant view of the sunset from the viewpoints of Mount Abu. Places to visit in Mount Abu: Nakki Lake, Sunset Point, Dilwara Temples How to reach: Mount Abu is situated almost 163km away from the city of Udaipur. So, the most convenient way to go there would be either by bus or a car.Best time to visit: November to June Things To Do In Mount Abu: Explore the architectural structures Places To Stay: HG Grandiose Hotel, Sterling Mount Abu, Hotel Vishram, Hotel Swagat, Lasa Grand Ideal Duration: 1-2 days Explore These 7 Airports In Rajasthan Before Flying To The Princely State! Guru Shikhar Affectionately known as the Peak of the Guru, the Guru Shikhar Hill Station is widely considered by the tourists as a land of tranquility. Acknowledged as one of the most famous hill stations of Rajasthan, it was after the god, Dattatreya, who was staying on this place during his early days. Located quite close to the Mount Abu hill stations in Rajasthan, Guru Shikhar hill station offers excellent panoramic views to the visitors. Along with enjoying the beautiful scenery, you can also indulge in numerous adventurous activities, such as trekking, here. Because of being located far away from the bustling city life, the environment of this place also stays quite calm and serene. Places to visit in Guru Shikhar: Dattatreya Temple, Guru Shikhar Peak How to reach: Guru Shikhar is located only 10.5km away from Mount Abu. So, if you are thinking to go there from Mount Abu, then a simple cab ride will do the job. Best time to visit: October to March Things To Do: Go trekking, Explore temples Places To Stay: The Raj Villas, Lake View Villa Mount Abu, Achal Resort, Wordsworth Lodge 3. Sajjangarh Located atop a serene hill, the majestic palace of Sajjangarh looks quite enthralling with a mesmerizing mountain range as a backdrop. Established in the year of 1884, this beautiful place is considered to be an ideal summer haven for tourists, who are trying to stay away from the heat of summer. Branded as one of the top hill stations in Rajasthan by the tourists, the beautiful palace offers an exquisite panoramic view of the Udaipur city. From this palace, you will also be able to experience the breathtaking view of the Fateh Sagar Lake will stay in your memory for days. It is one of the beautiful hill stations of Rajasthan. Places to visit in Sajjangarh: Sajjangarh Palace, Fateh Sagar Lake How to reach: The place is located only 11.4km away from the city of Udaipur. So, you can get into a taxi from the town for coming here.Best time to visit: November to February Things To Do: Enjoy the view of Fatehsagar Lake Places To Stay: The Raj Villas, Lake View Villa Mount Abu, Achal Resort, Wordsworth Lodge, Elegant 2BHK House Kumbhalgarh Fort: The Crowning Glory Of Rajasthan For A Perfect Trip Planning your holiday in Rajasthan but confused about what to do? Achalgarh Carefully nestled in the beautiful Aravalli range, Achalgarh looks like a subtle piece of paradise when viewed from the ground. Known as one of the best hill stations in Rajasthan, it is located only 11 km away from Mount Abu, which makes it an ideal weekend getaway from the nearby towns like Jodhpur and Udaipur. Most people generally travel to Achalgarh to experience the serenity of the mountains. However, if you have an adventurous mind, then you can also indulge in trekking here. Places to visit in Achalgarh: Achalgarh Fort, Mandakini Lake, Achaleshwar Mahadev Temple How to reach: The Achalgarh hill station is situated at a distance of 173km from Udaipur. Therefore, it would be convenient for you to board a bus or a cab from the city. Best time to visit: November to February Things To Do: Trekking Places To Stay: Achal Resort, Lake View Villa Mount Abu, The Raj Villas, Elegant 2BHK House, Wordsworth Lodge 5. Ranakpur Nestled in the elongated Aravalli Mountain range, Ranakpur is one of the small village hill stations of Rajasthan, which is known for its eloquent natural beauty. Besides these, this place also houses numerous historically important architectures, which are quite famous among people. Due to these reasons, most tourists consider this place to be one of the best places for a weekend getaway from the metropolises like Jodhpur, Udaipur, and Jaipur. Known as one of the best hill stations in Rajasthan, Ranakpur will transfix you with its ethereal landscapes and its beautiful Jain temples. So, if you are a nature-aficionado, then you will surely fall in love with this tiny piece of paradise. Places to visit in Ranakpur: Ranakpur Jain Temple, Kumbhalgarh Wildlife Sanctuary, Chamukha Temple, Kumbhalgarh Fort How to reach: Ranakpur is located almost 162 km away from Jodhpur. So, you would have to either opt for a car or the bus services to come here. Best time to visit: October to February Things To Do: Explore architectures, Jain temples Places To Stay: Ranakpur Hill Resort, Chandra Hill Resort, Ideal Lake View Resort, Hotel Aranyawas, Roopam Resort Ideal Duration: 1 day 12 Temples In Rajasthan: Re-Impose Faith While Touring This State As An Explorer Rajasthan is nothing but mere deserts. Right? Wrong. These magnificent hill stations in Rajasthan go on to prove there is more to this rich Indian state than just deserts and camels. Now plan a holiday in Rajasthan soon to explore all of these with your loved ones. For our editorial codes of conduct and copyright disclaimer please click here. Frequently Asked Questions About Hill Stations In Rajasthan What are some of the best hill stations in Rajasthan? If wish to enjoy the serenity of hill stations in Rajasthan, you can plan a trip to Mount Abu, Guru Shikhar, Sajjangarh, Achalgarh, and Ranakpur. What is the highest peak in Rajasthan? Guru Shikhar at a height of 5650 feet is considered to be the highest peak of both the Aravalli Range as well as Rajasthan. Which cities in Rajasthan are closer to the hill stations? Jodhpur and Udaipur in Rajasthan are situated quite close to the hill stations of this royal state. Which are the best places to visit in Mount Abu? Nakki Lake, Dilwara Jain Temples, Peace Park, Guru Shikhar Peak, Mount Abu Wildlife Sanctuary, Sunset Point, Achalgarh Fort, Toad Rock, Trevor’s Tank, and Sri Raghunath Temple are some of the best places you can visit in Mount Abu. Which are the best hill stations near Udaipur? Mount Abu, Toranmal, Girnar Hill, Saputara, Pachmarhi, Suryamal, and Lonavala are some of the most popular hill stations near Udaipur.
